unnormalised: So, someone asked about getting into good colleges after scoring just 60% in 12th. Honestly, it's a bit tough, but not impossible! Many students, like my cousin Riya who got 65% in her boards, felt the same way. She was aiming for Delhi University but thought it was a lost cause.
normalised: So, someone asked about getting into good colleges after scoring just sixty percent in twelfth. Honestly, it's a bit tough, but not impossible! Many students, like my cousin Riya who got sixty five percent in her boards, felt the same way. She was aiming for Delhi University but thought it was a lost cause.

unnormalised: The key is to explore alternative options. Direct merit-based admissions in top colleges are definitely going to be competitive with such a score. But you could look at colleges that conduct entrance exams. For example, some private universities like Amity or Symbiosis might be a good fit. Also, consider degree courses that aren't as popular but have good job prospects. A BSc in a specialized field could be a good bet. Plus, you could also explore distance learning options from institutions like IGNOU.
normalised: The key is to explore alternative options. Direct merit-based admissions in top colleges are definitely going to be competitive with such a score. But you could look at colleges that conduct entrance exams. For example, some private universities like Amity or Symbiosis might be a good fit. Also, consider degree courses that aren't as popular but have good job prospects. A B-S-c in a specialized field could be a good bet. Plus, you could also explore distance learning options from institutions like I-G-N-O-U.

unnormalised: Another thing to consider is improving your skills. Maybe do a certification course in something related to your field of interest. A good score in CAT, MAT or other MBA entrance tests can open doors to good management colleges even with lower 12th scores. Riya ended up doing a diploma in graphic design, and then got into a decent college for her Bachelor's degree. She's now working at a top firm in Bangalore.
normalised: Another thing to consider is improving your skills. Maybe do a certification course in something related to your field of interest. A good score in C-A-T, M-A-T or other M-B-A entrance tests can open doors to good management colleges even with lower twelfth scores. Riya ended up doing a diploma in graphic design, and then got into a decent college for her Bachelor's degree. She's now working at a top firm in Bangalore.

unnormalised: Don't lose hope! There are always pathways. Focus on your strengths, research your options thoroughly, and prep well for entrance exams. Getting 60% isn't the end of the road, and with hard work and smart choices, you can still achieve your goals. Good luck!
normalised: Don't lose hope! There are always pathways. Focus on your strengths, research your options thoroughly, and prep well for entrance exams. Getting sixty percent isn't the end of the road, and with hard work and smart choices, you can still achieve your goals. Good luck!
